data.enText: a type of heavy, sticky earth that becomes hard when it is baked and is used to make things such as pots and bricks
have feet of clay
to have a fault or weakness in your character

data.text: soil ♦ mud ♦ clay ♦ land ♦ earth ♦ dirt ♦ ground

data.enText: These are all words for the top layer of the earth in which plants grow.
soil
the top layer of the earth in which plants grow

data.chText: 把幼苗种在湿润的土壤里。
data.enText: Plant the seedlings in damp soil.
mud
wet soil that is soft and sticky

data.chText: 汽车轮子陷到泥里去了。
data.enText: The car wheels got stuck in the mud.
clay
a type of heavy sticky soil that becomes hard when it is baked and is used to make things such as pots and bricks

data.chText: 这些砖是用陶土制成的。
data.enText: The tiles are made of clay.
land

data.chText: 尤指某种类型的地带、土地：
data.enText: an area of ground, especially of a particular type
an area of rich, fertile land
earth
the substance that plants grow in

data.chText: * earth常用以指花园里或种花用的泥土：
data.enText: Earth is often used about the soil found in gardens or used for gardening.

data.chText: 她在花盆里放了一些泥土。
data.enText: She put some earth into the pot.
dirt
( especially NAmE ) soil, especially loose soil
Pack the dirt firmly around the plants.
ground
an area of soil
The car got stuck in the muddy ground.

data.chText: 他们驶过数英里崎岖不平、多石的土地。
data.enText: They drove across miles of rough, stony ground.
Ground is not used for loose soil.
a handful of dry ground
good/rich soil/land/earth
fertile/infertile soil/land/ground
to dig the soil/land/earth/ground
to cultivate the soil/land/earth/ground
a lump of soil/mud/clay/earth
a piece of clay/land/earth/ground
a plot of land/ground
have feet of clay
to have a fault or weakness in your character

tr: the dead body of a human being
example: the cadaver was intended for dissection
the end of the police search was the discovery of a corpse
the murderer confessed that he threw the stiff in the river
honor comes to bless the turf that wraps their clay

tr: a very fine-grained soil that is plastic when moist but hard when fired

value.def: Clay is a kind of earth that is soft when it is wet and hard when it is dry. Clay is shaped and baked to make things such as pots and bricks.

example.tran: 剑桥郡的重黏土质土壤

example.ex: As the wheel turned, the potter shaped and squeezed the lump of clay into a graceful shape.
example.tran: 随着陶轮的转动，制陶工人缓慢挤压陶泥块，塑出优美的造型。

value.def: In tennis, matches played on clay are played on courts whose surface is covered with finely crushed stones or brick.

example.ex: Most tennis is played on hard courts, but a substantial amount is played on clay...
example.tran: 多数网球比赛在硬地球场上举行，不过也有相当数量的比赛在红土球场上进行。

example.ex: He was a clay-court specialist who won Wimbledon five times.
example.tran: 他是红土场上的专家，曾5次在温布尔登夺冠。

value.tran: 红土网球场;沙地网球场

value.def: If you say that a person who is respected or admired has feet of clay or has clay feet, you mean that they have serious faults which you or other people did not know about before.

example.ex: When those idols are found to have feet of clay, the pain of disenchantment can be profound.
example.tran: 当人们发现那些偶像有严重的缺陷时，会产生无比痛苦的失落感。

value.tran: （受人崇仰的人的）不为人知的严重缺点(或缺陷)

trans: （受人崇仰的人的）不为人知的严重缺点(或缺陷)
(供射击训练用的)泥鸽，碟形飞靶
（受人崇仰的人的）不为人知的严重缺点(或缺陷)
